sections.title: Description
sections.raw_content: The sqrt function is used to find the square root of a number. For example, sqrt (4) is 2.
sections.text_content: The sqrt function is used to find the square root of a number. For example, sqrt (4) is 2.
sections.mdown_content: The **sqrt** function is used to find the square root of a number. For example, **sqrt** (4) is 2.

sections.title: Example
code:
for i : 1 .. 100
            put "Square root of ", i, " is ", sqrt ( i )
        end for
sections.raw_content: This program prints out the square roots of 1, 2, 3, … up to 100.
sections.text_content: This program prints out the square roots of 1, 2, 3, Â… up to 100.
sections.mdown_content: This program prints out the square roots of 1, 2, 3, … up to 100.

sections.title: Details
sections.raw_content:
It is illegal to try to take the square root of a negative number. The result of sqrt is always positive or zero.

The opposite of a square root is the square. For example, the square of x is written is x**2.
sections.text_content:
It is illegal to try to take the square root of a negative number. The result of sqrt is always positive or zero.
The opposite of a square root is the square. For example, the square of x is written is x**2.
sections.mdown_content:
It is illegal to try to take the square root of a negative number. The result of **sqrt** is always positive or zero.

The opposite of a square root is the square. For example, the square of _x_ is written is _x_**2.
